text: (inspiring music)

- [Prerana] Technology has
always been a passion of mine,

because I could actually
solve problems in my community

and convert that creative
thinking into something real.
My name is Prerana Sapkota.
I am an AWS Scholarship student,
and I live in Kathmandu, Nepal.

- Hello.
- Hi.
- Vaá¹‡akkam.
- I'm from Himachal Pradesh, India.

- I'm interested in
artificial intelligence.

- If they can do it,
then I can do it, too.
(soothing music)

- [Prerana] I grew up in
the small city of Baglung,
outside of Kathmandu,

with my mother, grandparents,
and younger siblings.
I love being Nepali.

I am who I am
(bell ringing)
because of all the people around me,

and I feel so proud looking
around my community.
(birds chirping)

Growing up in a small village,
there is an expectation

that girls get married
at around 18 years old
and that the son of the family
will take care of the parents.
But I did not see that being my path.

Education is something that
can make you independent,

so I moved from my small
city of Baglung to Kathmandu

because I had bigger dreams
to pursue my education
and take care of my parents by myself.
(upbeat music)

When I started the AWS
AI & ML Scholarship program,
I could actually learn through doing.
By doing, I could understand a lot
of coding concepts more easily,

and I was able to take my
education into my own hands,

which has given me the
confidence to think big.
(gentle music)

In Kathmandu, we are
facing a water crisis.
Overpopulation and over-exploitation
of groundwater reserves
have led to water scarcity in Kathmandu.
We have to rely on water tank

because underground
water has been extinct.
(hopeful music)
(keys clicking)
I have started to develop a project
to combat water scarcity.

Using AI and an IoT device
to monitor water levels,
we can collect water consumption data
to create a predictive analysis.
This would allow us to implement
more sustainable water usage habits
to avoid depleting groundwater.
We are responsible for everything
that we do in this environment.
We should care about it and use it wisely.

I believe that this
project is gonna help a lot
to preserve the underground water
and to preserve our nature.
I feel connected with Nepal.
I have taken a lot from this community.
Why not give back to this community
what I have learned?
